intro: Adoxa, commonly known as false unicorn, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Orobanchaceae. These plants are typically herbaceous and often have a creeping or semi-woody growth habit. They are characterized by their small, usually white or pink flowers that are arranged in clusters. Adoxa species are native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere and are often found in moist, shaded environments. The genus includes several species, some of which are used in traditional medicine.
